greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of skew Dyck paths of semilength n and having k UUU's (triplerises) (n >= 0; 0 <= k <= n-2 for n >= 2).
comment: A skew Dyck path is a path in the first quadrant which begins at the origin, ends on the x-axis, consists of steps U=(1,1)(up), D=(1,-1)(down) and L=(-1,-1)(left) so that up and left steps do not overlap. The length of the path is defined to be the number of its steps.
link: E. Deutsch, E. Munarini, S. Rinaldi, Skew Dyck paths, J. Stat. Plann. Infer. 140 (8) (2010) 2191-2203
formula: G.f.: G = G(t,z) satisfies z(t + z - tz)G^2 - (1 - z - z^2 + tz^2)G + 1 - tz = 0.
example: T(3,1)=4 because we have UUUDDD, UUUDLD, UUUDDL and UUUDLL.
maple: eq:=z*(t+z-t*z)*G^2-(1-z-z^2+t*z^2)*G+1-t*z=0: G:=RootOf(eq,G): Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,14)): for n from 0 to 12 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(Gser,z,n)) od: 1; 1; for n from 2 to 11 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=0..n-2) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 30 2007
